intro: Trichera sylvatica, commonly known as the forest trichera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Central and South America. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are showy, with five petals arranged in a star-like pattern. Trichera sylvatica produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
